title.narrative: 3.1 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SAFE DRINKING WATER

description.narrative: Increased number people, in rural areas, small towns and urban centres as well as at schools and health centres have access to safe and affordable drinking water, especially women and girls., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Environmental Sustainability, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, increased numbers of people, especially girls and women, socially excluded groups and others in vulnerable situations, are healthy and live in resilient communities, access affordable and equitable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services and abandon open defecation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased number people, in rural areas, small towns and urban centres as well as at schools and health centres have access to safeand affordable drinking water, especially women and girls.

description.narrative: UNICEF made a significant achievement in increasing access to water for communities, schools and health facilities in 2020. During ;the reporting period (January-November 2020,) UNICEF provided 643,979 people ;with access to safe and affordable water-supply systems. Of this remarkable number, 579,104 people were connected through community water-supply systems, 37,058 through school-water facilities and 27,817 people through health-centre water facilities. ;These results were achieved through the drilling of new boreholes, rehabilitation of existing ones and establishing water supply systems for much improved access in rural areas, small towns and IDP settlements. | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/12/2020
